text:
Is this really my face?

Well, of course it is, but…

Is there a filter on this camera?

Nope.

Well… damn.

I turned out good.

Jungkook stared into the screen of Seokjin’s phone, one hand gripping the device tightly, the other smoothing across high cheekbones, tall nose, pale pink lips and then across to his sharp jawline. Though still boyish, his childish face had gone; there were no more chubby curves and stubborn baby fat – his face was all sharp lines and angles. There were some inconspicuous, fading, dull red pigments smattered across his lower cheek, evidence of his teenage, hormonal acne, but besides that his complexion was flawless. His gaze flickered up to his eyes, perhaps his only feature that looked virtually unchanged, doe-eyes with dark lashes, and yet the youthful innocence that used to shine in them was gone, and instead burned something a bit more cunning.

“How old am I, again?” Jungkook asked, his voice deeper, a maturity in his tone, handing the phone back to his friend and doctor.

“Twenty-two,” Seokjin answered with a smile, telling him to just place it on the bed because he already had a clipboard in one hand, pen in the other.

Jungkook blinked up at his friend – he was so glad they were still friends – and noted the fine lines around his mouth. Seokjin still looked great though, definitely didn’t look twenty-seven, but Jungkook being Jungkook couldn’t let this opportunity pass. “Wow, hyung, you got old.”

Seokjin rolled his eyes with a scoff. “Oh right, you already were such a brat at seventeen. I wouldn’t be making jabs at the person who’s going to be treating you.” As if to prove his point, he scribbled something down on the paper.

Jungkook laughed, wincing when he felt a sharp sting across his ribs. He breathed in sharply and scrunched his face up in pain.

“Sorry, the painkillers will kick in soon,” Seokjin said, noticing his discomfit; he was a doctor after all.

“Are you still with Namjoon-hyung?” Jungkook asked to distract himself, glancing away from an ugly scratch up his arm.

At that, Seokjin’s hand clenched and Jungkook swore he saw a flicker of hurt. “No.”

Jungkook felt a pang of sympathy, and a whole lot of disbelief. They were always so happy together, everyone was so sure they were soulmates… but it had apparently been five years, and a lot could happen in that amount of time. “Oh. Sorry.” He felt like an asshole for asking, especially since he should have known not to – or shouldn’t have had to.

Seokjin sighed and sat down, hands clasped together. “So you really don’t remember anything since seventeen?”

Jungkook swallowed and tried to reminisce on something, but he really had no idea what he was trying to be thinking of. “Uh, no?”

“You just think you’re in high school?”

“Yeah, grade eleven. I have a maths exam next week – or, I mean, I did. God, I wonder if I passed – ”

“Jungkook,” Seokjin cut in but he was holding back a grin, Jungkook could tell. “And yes, you passed, by the skin of your teeth.”

“You remember?”

“You made us throw a party for you, spoilt baby.”

“Ah, of course I did.”

Seokjin stood up and rubbed his forehead. “I don’t think it’s really set in for you yet, Kook, but hey, that’s okay,” he said and gave him a reassuring smile, warm and caring, like an older brother or parent, “most people get their memories back eventually. You may not get all of them, but you’ll at least get some, I’m sure. Five years is not too bad. We’re all here to help anyway.”

Jungkook swallowed and nodded sheepishly, a bit embarrassed for acting so casual about the serious matter. He brought a hand up to his head and his fingers ghosted over the bandage, not daring to apply any pressure. He’d woken up confused and drowsy in a hospital bed, wondering how he had got there when he was pretty sure he had fallen asleep over his school notebooks after pulling an all-nighter the day before. He thought maybe he had fainted or something. He had certainly not expected to be told by some kind but annoying nurses that no, he was not seventeen and he had been in a car accident.

But I can’t even drive was the first thing that popped into his head, but then they started saying how the other driver – a drunk – was also conscious and recovering and that despite the damage to both cars neither had sustained major injuries. Jungkook felt all bitter when they had said that because fucking excuse you, I’ve lost five years of my life, is that not major enough for you?

“Are we all still friends?” Jungkook asked curiously, a feeling of dread building inside him as he thought about the five other people he had spent his teenage years with, hoping that they still were. He would be crushed if Seokjin told him he had a fight with someone and now they never talked.

“Of course,” Seokjin replied with a laugh and Jungkook was instantly relieved. “You meet up with Taehyung quite often – he’s a teacher, and Hoseok and his dance crew are touring currently but they’ll be back late next month, Yoongi’s a famous architect and Namjoon’s a lawyer,” Seokjin trailed off with a sad curl to his lips.

Their breakup must have been really terrible, and it looks recent.

Jungkook took all the information in in awe. He felt pride swell in his chest for Hoseok because, as much as Jungkook had loved it, Hoseok was someone born to dance. He wasn’t surprised in the slightest that Taehyung became a teacher after several university degree changes, no doubt he would be the kind, entertaining, handsome teacher that girls fawned over and boys wanted to be like with his unique sense of humour and sharp wit. Yoongi’s occupation was unexpected but then again, he always had amazing ideas and could do anything if he put the time and effort in. And yes, of course, Namjoon in the justice system was so fitting.

“What am I?” Jungkook asked, curious. He wondered if he had gotten successful too.

“You own a lamb skewer store.”

Jungkook couldn’t help the grin that broke out on his face. “Really? Holy shit, I can’t believe it. I actually did it!”

Seokjin suddenly made a face and then his classic window cleaning laugh bellowed out into the room, high pitched at surprisingly equal intervals. “Ah, I can’t believe you fell for it!”

Jungkook felt his happiness deflate. “What? I don’t own a lamb skewer store?”

“I wish you did. Unfortunately, no,” Seokjin wiped his eyes and stood up, straightening his jacket. “You’re a lawyer too.”

“A lawyer.”

“Yep.”

“Stop joking.”

“Okay, you’re not a lawyer yet but you’ve just graduated from university with your law degree,” Seokjin elaborated and then a flash of worry, coupled with a bit of amusement, crossed his features. “Ooh, I can’t even begin to wonder how bad it would have been if you had clients already – a lawyer losing his memory, that cannot be good. And wow, you’ve forgotten all your university years too, but I’m sure the law stuff will come back naturally.”

Jungkook’s mind was spinning. What on earth would have possessed him to want to take up law? And what if his memories didn’t come back and he had to go back to university? That would be torture – not that he could remember what it had been like but he was sure it must have been torture. He squeezed his eyes shut and took a few deep breaths. “Okay. Okay, so… so, what now?”

“Well, I’m giving you some antibiotics and painkillers,” Seokjin stood up and began writing on something again in his illegible doctor’s scrawl. “But I think the best thing is to try settle back into your life and hopefully your memories will come back eventually. Just be patient. Oh, and you will have to talk to the authorities about pressing charges. You would have been more than capable of handling this if you hadn’t forgotten your legal study. I’ll call, uh, Namjoon and let him know – he’ll make sure it all works out,” Seokjin made a pained expression and Jungkook hated seeing his hyung like that.

“Don’t worry, I-I’ll do it.” Jungkook tried but Seokjin waved off his offer.

“I’ll be fine, we’re still friends, somewhat. Anyway, Jimin’s coming to pick you up in five minutes so cheer up.” Seokjin said as he glanced at his watch.

Jimin?

“Who?” Jungkook asked as a flash of a muscular nineteen year old boy in muscle tees and basketball shorts entered his mind. Not that Jimin… right?

“You don’t remember Jimin? Park Jimin?” Seokjin frowned with pure shock and he counted something on his fingers. “You knew him at seventeen!” he said in a tone almost accusatory.

Jungkook rolled his eyes. “Yes, yes, I remember. But why is he coming to pick me up?”

He grimaced at the thought of the older. It wasn’t that Jungkook didn’t like Jimin, it was just that he was a bit annoying – he was always so touchy and clingy and always doing that annoying flirty smile and making his liking for Jungkook embarrassingly obvious, and shamelessly unaffected by it. Jimin was fun when he toned it back, when they chatted about Big Bang and did singing covers together or mucked around until two in the morning playing hide and seek with Taehyung, but other times Jungkook just didn’t know how to act around him – torn between being nice because he was the younger of the two, or scoffing and asking Jimin to leave him alone.

“Why?” Seokjin repeated and then he made a sound of realisation. “Ah. Right. Well… Jungkook, don’t freak out, but… Jimin is your boyfriend.”

Okay, Seokjin and Namjoon broken up he could accept.

And him studying law he could deal with.

But him dating Park Jimin? No fucking way. That, he could not swallow.

Jungkook sat up fast and then regretted it when his muscles screamed in protest and he almost started coughing from the way his ribs seemed to collapse into his body. “W-What? Boyfriend? What?”

“I said don’t freak out!”

“What! What?”

“Just – relax for goodness sake, lie back down,” Seokjin berated as he checked the tubes going into Jungkook’s arm. He practically shoved the stubborn younger down back onto the pillows. For a doctor, he was unnecessarily rough. “You’ve been dating for almost three years.”

Three years? With Park Jimin?

Jungkook’s heart rate picked up and he was very close to thinking this was all some sort of weird dream and any second he was going to wake up because he always woke up when he was about to die in his dreams and dating Park Jimin was maybe the equivalent of that. Any second now he was going to wake up in his room, in his very seventeen year old body, and realise he needed to pass this damn maths test.

When all that happened was Seokjin staring at him waiting for his response, he realised with dismay that this was very much reality.

“Did I lose some kind of bet?” Jungkook whispered, horrified.

Seokjin’s expression twisted. “Do not say that, and especially not to him. You love him, Jungkook, you’re bloody whipped for him.”

Jungkook blanched at the words. He never thought he’d ever hear anyone say that. “R-Really? Is this really the same Park Jimin? Did something happen? I mean – what – but I can’t stand him – what…”

“Look, just, I explained to Jimin what happened. He’s not going to make you kiss him or anything, just be nice to him or present day Jungkook, or future Jungkook for you, will come back and kick your fucking ass into the next century,” Seokjin said with a huff but the warning was there – and obviously Jungkook couldn’t exactly beat himself up but it was pretty clear he was going to regret it deeply.

Jungkook nodded like a child being scolded (and well, he was still a child, mentally). “I… okay.”

“Be nice. You love him.” Seokjin stressed.

“Okay!”

“I’m making sure it gets through your thick head, because seventeen year old Jungkook was never that nice to Jimin.”

“That’s not fair! He was annoying.”

“Don’t say that, geez,” Seokjin sighed and he looked sincerely worried for Jungkook’s sake. “I’m serious, if you fuck it up you’re in for a world of pain when your memories come back.”

Now Jungkook didn’t think this was exactly fair.

He didn’t remember any particularly fond thoughts or have any romantic feelings for Jimin at all, but if Seokjin said so then he must. He pressed his lips together and crossed his arms (then remembered he couldn’t because of the tubes) and rubbed his eyes instead. He wondered what Jimin would look like now, probably even more muscular than before, and maybe louder and more confident and a flirt. Did Jungkook really fall for a guy like that? And if so, what did that say about him, then?

Seokjin nudged at a few items on the table beside the bed. “This is your phone and wallet – they’re both pretty beat up, sorry. I think it’s safe to say your phone is beyond repair,” he held up an object with a shattered screen and a side completely crushed, “but your credit cards actually survived. Good thing you never carried around cash.”

“Lucky,” Jungkook muttered flatly as he stared at the probably once beautiful device. This was the worst day of his life. His phone from the future (so to speak) was broken. Great. He picked up his wallet with weak hands and clutched it in his less scratched up one.

Seokjin’s phone beeped and he took a deep breath after glancing swiftly at the screen. “Jimin’s here. I’ll explain your injuries and medication to him. As for you – ”

“Be nice, I got it.”

“Yes, that too, but also no sports, no exercising, no seeing if you can jump over the couch or blind-folded hide and seek bullshit – yes, you still act like that. Your ribs are bruised and you probably have a concussion. And if you hit your head again, God help me,” Seokjin groaned as he headed for the door of the small, patient room they were in. He poked his head out, probably in case Jimin got lost or wandered into the wrong room.

Jungkook bit on his lip and then winced when he realised there was a painful cut right in the centre. He groaned in pain and misery for his situation. At least he would be out of this room soon. Jungkook loved the smell of soap but that sickly hospital stench of harsh chemicals and detergents was even a bit much for him. He glanced outside and wondered how much the world had changed – probably a lot, and yet, not enough.

His head slowly shifted to the side as he heard Seokjin greet someone friendlily.

“Hi, hyung.” A soft voice reached his ears and he couldn’t see the speaker yet but he knew that was Jimin. His voice was exactly as he thought it would be – slightly pitched, gentle, sweet. He may find Jimin annoying but even he couldn’t deny he had the most soothing voice out of his group of friends, when he wasn’t whining or trying to get attention, that is.

“Come in.” Seokjin said quickly and shot Jungkook another warning look.

Yes, be nice, I’m seventeen or twenty-two, not three.

Jungkook sort of expected to see that stocky boy walk in, maybe in loose shorts and a singlet with a backwards cap, but instead someone gracefully slim with an elegant aura walked in.

Jungkook felt something in his chest ache and he was quite certain it wasn’t an injury.

Jimin – was this really Jimin? – was staring at the ground but his hair was a light, ashy blonde and his skin fairer than he remembered. He was wearing a soft looking sweater that was a few inches too long at the sleeves and fitted jeans that accentuated his trim legs. He had some shopping bag in one hand and was gripping it with white knuckles.

“Jimin?” Jungkook asked doubtfully.

Jimin finally lifted his head and their eyes met and Jungkook sort of expected to feel some sort of connection, but he didn’t. Regardless, Jimin was shockingly gorgeous. His eyes were warm and kind, and his lips full. His face was slimmer too, but there was some slight chubbiness lingering on the top of his cheeks but they actually made him look… cute.

He had just called Park Jimin cute.

He must have hit his head hard.

“Jungkookie.” Jimin whispered and looked like he was going to rush forward and throw himself in his arms but then hesitated. He swallowed and turned to Seokjin for help.

“Here, sit down.” Seokjin took control and lead Jimin to the chair. Jungkook noticed the way Jimin was wringing his hands with worry.

“Are you okay?” Jimin asked, eyes filled with overflowing concern.

“Uh, yes.” Jungkook replied awkwardly. This was so strange. This guy was his boyfriend.

Jimin’s gaze rested on his face for a few seconds before darting to his hands and Jungkook didn’t miss the way his shoulders slumped, following the long, red, angry scratch. “Are you still hurting?”

“My ribs hurt, but, yeah it’s all good,” Jungkook answered hastily. It was by no means ‘all good.’ He was going to give this drunk driver a piece of his mind when he saw him. Like it wasn’t even evening, or the afternoon – it was freaking morning – who got drunk so early in the day? He noticed Seokjin glaring at him and then jerk his chin towards Jimin. Right. “Sorry, for… uh… I really don’t remember us t-together… at all.”

Jimin shrugged half-heartedly, evident sadness desperately trying to be hidden. “It’s not your fault.”

Well, no. It really isn’t.

Jungkook didn’t know what to say in response so he just nodded and looked at something else. He heard Seokjin begin to explain Jungkook’s injuries and medication and Jimin listened attentively, eyes wide and teeth sinking into his bottom lip.

Jungkook didn’t remember Jimin like this at all. Jimin was confident and overbearing – this Jimin was quiet and shy.

Then again, you did lose your memory and he’s probably worried sick about you.

He sighed as he drifted out of the conversation, hoping desperately that some part of his memory would hurry up and come back. He snapped out of it when Jimin stood up, papers and prescription in his hand.

“Okay, Kook, you can go now,” Seokjin said and moved to the side of the bed to remove the tubes attached to him, then moved to help him off the bed.

Jungkook winced and flinched as he tried to twist his body and swing his legs off the bed, hot pain shooting up his arms, across his back, muscles wanting to give out. What sort of shitty painkillers did Seokjin give him? Was he really a doctor?

“Hyung…” Jimin’s thick voice cut through in an almost plea. He sounded so small and helpless. “Maybe… maybe he should stay… he’s in so much pain.”

Seokjin opened his mouth to reply but Jungkook cut in before he could stop himself.

“I can do it.” He hissed in a tone harsher than he meant for. He didn’t intend for the hard edge, it was just at that precise moment his wrist ached and the soreness came out in his voice. And maybe he was a little annoyed that Jimin would think he couldn’t do it – Jimin was always babying him and thinking he couldn’t do things for himself.

Jimin gulped. “Sorry.”

“Jungkook.” Seokjin whispered under his breath and shot Jungkook an angry look. “He’s just worried.”

Jungkook gritted his teeth and ignored him. Seokjin helped him get his feet on the ground and take a few shaky steps. The first few were difficult but they progressively got easier. He realised that he must have gotten taller because he had a good few inches on Seokjin who was already quite tall. I wonder if I’m taller than Namjoon as well.

Jungkook glanced at Jimin (who now looked even shorter than before) who was fumbling in the bag he brought. He pulled out some dark coloured clothes. “I brought your jumper and some sweatpants. I figured you wouldn’t want to walk out in that.”

Jungkook looked down at his hospital gown and flushed. “Thanks.”

“Um,” Jimin handed it to him quickly and Seokjin pointed to the bathroom door. Jungkook walked slowly to it, eyes studying the jumper, glad his taste in clothes was still relatively the same.

“Will you be okay?” Seokjin called after him. “Because Jimin can help you change.”

“I’m fine!” Jungkook snapped with reddening cheeks, glad his back was to them.

“It’s not like he hasn’t already seen everything –”

“Hyung!” Jimin squeaked, embarrassed.

Jungkook was too, but it caught him by surprise that Jimin was. He was honestly expecting Jimin to have made some dirty joke. He stepped into the tiny bathroom and closed the door with a heavy sigh.

This was the worst day of his life.

And then, Jungkook wanted to scream in frustration because he couldn’t even be sure of that.

 

 

 

 

“We live together?” Jungkook mumbled as Jimin’s grip on the keys slipped for the second time and he had to bend down and pick them up again. He had been all jittery in the car and had tried to make conversation but it was too awkward between them.

Jungkook and Jimin had hung out together before but they actually never shared that much to each other (or at least, Jungkook didn’t) so he honestly had no idea what to say. The fact that they were boyfriends didn’t help. All he could think of were the games he felt like they played last weekend or that time they smeared ice cream on Yoongi and spent a good hour running away. But they were all five years ago topics. What was he supposed to say now?

“Yeah.” Jimin replied and glanced at Jungkook quickly, lowering his gaze as soon as Jungkook looked at him.

Is he always this nervous around me? What kind of relationship is this?

I’m not one of those overbearing, commanding, foul boyfriends, am I?

Holy fuck I hope not.

“Do you want me to do it?” Jungkook reached for the keys that were shaking in Jimin’s hands. Honestly, it seemed like Jimin was the one who had just been in the accident.

“N-no.” Jimin shook his head in humiliation, face red, and finally managed to put the key in and unlock the door. “Taehyung lives a few doors down, and Yoongi and Hoseok two storeys up.”

Jungkook glanced around the apartment hall and simply nodded. The complex looked quite new, or at least in very good condition, and it was modern and stylish. At twenty-two, he was lucky to be living somewhere so nice. Even if it was with Park Jimin. His boyfriend, apparently.

No, definitely. He was definitely his boyfriend.

Jimin opened the door and gestured for Jungkook to walk in first, perhaps in case he stumbled, and Jungkook couldn’t deny he was shocked by their flat. It had a spacious living room and a decent sized kitchen and interesting artworks and photos were framed on the walls. He was momentarily impressed by the size of the television before glancing to the speakers and then the laptop on the table.

“Our bedroom is down there.” Jimin pointed towards a door and then walked hastily to the kitchen to put down Jungkook’s medication. Then he turned back to Jungkook, fingers knotting together.

“We share a bed?” Jungkook blurted before his common sense had time to kick in. Of course we do, we’re boyfriends of almost 3 years. Then he felt heat prick up his neck when he thought of what they could have possibly done on that bed. We may have even had sex. Oh shit, what if we have? We probably, definitely have. I don’t even remember my first time. Had it been with Jimin?

“Well, yes, but if you’re not comfortable I can sleep on the couch.” Jimin said with a soft smile. “I know we weren’t really that good of friends when you were seventeen.”

“Yeah, I can’t stand you.” Jungkook laughed before realising that this was not him being nice.

Jimin was staring at him with hurt all over his face and Jungkook didn’t have to love, or even like, Jimin to feel like a complete shit. He had meant it to be like a light joke, but it obviously wouldn’t be funny under these circumstances. If Jungkook – present/future Jungkook, that is – had said it, maybe Jimin would have seen the humour because present/future Jungkook has his memories and apparently was ‘whipped’ for Jimin. But seventeen year old Jungkook was not, and seventeen year old Jungkook felt this way currently.

He spoke in present tense for fuck’s sake.

“Shit, I’m sorry, Jimin, I…” Jungkook stood there awkwardly like the teenager he mentally was. “I didn’t mean – of course I can’t not stand, wait, I don’t can’t stand, I mean, I can stand you –”

He really didn’t think he was making anything better.

Jimin laughed, forced and strain. Fake, undeniably fake. “It’s alright. I understand. You should go lie down and get some more rest.”

Jungkook wasn’t really tired, but he figured anything would be better than rambling off again. He gave a tight smile and began his ungraceful walk to the bedroom, a definite limp in his step and a grimace of discomfit every now and then, at least the painkillers seemed to have finally kicked in.

He threw a quick glance back at Jimin in case he had been watching him wearily but found him hunched over the kitchen counter instead.

Jungkook felt that ache in his chest again, and wondered if that was present/future Jungkook trying to tell him something.

 

 

 

“Why are you so nervous around me?” Jungkook asked as Jimin had woken him up to take his antibiotics and replace his bandages. He even brought him some food to fill his stomach. Jungkook couldn’t deny that it was sort of nice to have someone pampering him. Hopefully, I pamper Jimin back too, right? Present/future Jungkook is a decent boyfriend, right?

“I’m not nervous.” Jimin replied as he finished replacing the bandage around his head, and then cleaned the wound on his back (Jungkook hadn’t even realised there was an injury on his back) and applied some cream to the scratches littered all over Jungkook’s body, as well as the awful bruises practically covering up his torso, across his biceps and on his shoulders. They ranged from dark red and blue to black and yellow and Jungkook saw the way Jimin visibly paled when he saw them.

“I’m okay.” Jungkook murmured as Jimin’s hand ghosted over them, eyes blinking rapidly. He wondered if maybe Jimin was all jumpy because he felt so bad for him, or thought that Jungkook was all fragile and would crumble into pieces if he spoke too loud or looked at him too long.

“No, you’re not.” Jimin said as he squeezed some more cream onto his hand. “You’re… you’re…” He breathed in sharply and simply turned his attention to the deep and wide graze on Jungkook’s knee.

Jungkook was sitting shirtless on the edge of their bathtub, just in his boxers, as Jimin fussed over him. He wanted to say something to make it better, but he really wasn’t good at comforting people. He wished he was, he hated seeing his friends upset, even Jimin.

“Sorry for making you worry like this.” Jungkook said finally.

Jimin did that shrug again, a weak, feeble movement.

“It must have been scary to hear I got in an accident.” Jungkook mumbled and then thought maybe that was a terribly timed thing to say.

“Yeah, Seokjin called me.” Jimin breathed and stopped, eyes scanning the cuts up Jungkook’s leg, the purple, inflamed bruise across his shin, “I thought… I thought I lost you for a second.” Jimin sighed and said quieter, “I guess I sort of did.”

Jungkook stiffened and felt his body go all cold at his devastated voice, and then the other part was quite offended because it wasn’t like Jungkook asked to lose his memory. This was just as frustrating for him as it must be for Jimin. He frowned and was about to retort something probably not very nice (he’d apologize to Seokjin later) when Jimin looked up at him with watery eyes.

He looked like a kicked puppy.

“Can I give you a hug?” Jimin’s voice was barely audible, and if it wasn’t for the echo of the bathroom Jungkook probably wouldn’t have heard it. “It doesn’t feel like you’re here, yet.” He looked down like he was embarrassed for having to ask, and he probably was. Jungkook was his boyfriend and here Jimin was asking if he could give him a hug. Even friends did that.

“Sure you can.” Jungkook answered and Jimin smiled in relief before he leaned forward and lightly wrapped his arms around his shoulders, careful not to apply too much pressure. It was awkward and stiff at first, until suddenly Jimin buried his face in the crook of Jungkook’s neck and let out a shuddery breath, like the kind when you were trying not to cry – the bad sort of crying too, the hiccups and uneven breathing and swollen eyes.

Jungkook brought his hands up and curled them around Jimin’s waist. He wasn’t as muscular as Jungkook remembered – Jimin’s shirt was a thin material so it was easy to tell. He was still toned and his stomach flat but he felt like he had put on a bit of weight. He could feel Jimin’s small frame trembling. Jungkook was an awful boyfriend, why didn’t he think about how Jimin would be feeling? That Jimin would need some comfort?

It was strange, thinking of Jimin as his significant other. Jungkook didn’t know how he felt about it.

“I’m sorry.” Jungkook said again because he honestly didn’t know what else to say.

Jimin just reluctantly pulled away and gave him a smile.

It didn’t touch his eyes.

And Jungkook hated how familiar it felt.

 

 

 

 

Jungkook raised another mug of coffee to his lips and almost drank the whole thing in one go.
